4.21.20  11:17 pm   Why did the chicken cross the road?

      the same reason the road crossed the chicken's path. the chicken and humans' trajectory were situated in a non-parallel orientation

      for every pigeon there are at least 2 other pigeons

      389

      perhaps i was doing it all wrong before

4.21.20  10:13 pm   hey, bill, how are you so epic?

      just got to keep pushing for higher and higher levels of ordinaryness, and normalcy

     yes

4.21.20  9:47 pm   will wfaoie be a series

      yes

4.21.20  9:46 pm   for you, what its imagination?

      i have only just begun to imagine

4.21.20  9:31 pm   do earth is flat or round?

      it's both. if you think that's impossible, then take a good look at a pizza

4.21.20  9:27 pm   Bill, I am so thankful you exist. My grandpa has coronavirus and I listen to your music. I showed it to my grandpa and he smiled and danced his head around. That was the first time he was happy in about a week. Thank you, I love you and your music so much, and so does my grandpa. Again, thanks for existing

      holy return to normal you are very friendly

4.21.20  9:10 pm   okay big question. say i have a DAW that records me playing the keyboard, but i want the final sound of the recorded track to not be that of the keyboard preset i played live, but that of a plugin/one of those DAW instrument presets. basically, i don't want to use my keyboard to type all the notes if i don't need to. h o w in the world is this achieved? does the ability to record your physical playing of keyboard AS a plugin depend on the make of the keyboard? ps sorry this is long-winded, i'm a complete amateur and my music terminology is limited atm

     i'm not entirely sure what you mean because it seems like some of the things you said go against other things you said ..... but if you are wondering how to record midi with a keyboard.... your keyboard needs to be a midi controller. and most of them are. in modern times that usually means you need to connect the keyboard with a USB cable, and then make sure you have the right MIDI driver installed on your computer (always available on the website for your keyboard.... so that would be the yamaha website, or korg website, roland, etc). and then you wanna tell your recording software that you are gonna record a MIDI track, not an audio track. then if you press record on a midi track, it will be listening for you to play your midi keyboard and it will record the midi data. and then you can use whatever sound you want, in the computer

4.21.20  9:06 pm   are computers hostile?

      no

4.21.20  8:17 pm   What should I do if I start a celery worshiping cult as a joke, but people take it seriously and actually join?

      kick them out

4.21.20  8:16 pm   Opinion on ducks?

      i know they can fly but i've never seen them do it

4.21.20  8:04 pm   what should i do. just tell me one thing that you did at any point in time that you did that you didn't regret doing afterwards. i don't care if it might not apply to my situation. i just need something

      tried to figure out the ideal just tuning system, which sent me spiraling into an existential conundrum, but yielded some enlightening knowledge which i carry with me to this day

4.21.20  5:43 pm   why is computer keyboard the way it is

      to stop people from typing too fast. this was important back when it was typewriters and the keys kept getting jammed if you type too fast. with the computer that's not important but everyone already was used to the layout

      1/1

4.21.20  5:23 pm   how long does it take to make a song and a full video for the song

      it was taking 8 to 11 weeks until i had a huge personal meltdown about it and was able to do it in 2 weeks, several times in a row. then i went and decided to re-invent the whole video department, so we'll see how it goes, but if it's anything longer than 2 weeks i will rise up in protest

      i can climb a ladder very high. does that count
